intro: Silene vulgaris f. grandifolia, commonly known as the large-flowered campion, is a flowering plant belonging to the Caryophyllaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a slightly serrated edge. The flowers are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems, and the plant is often found in temperate regions of Europe and Asia.
